attributes.action: Protect the 10-Year Long Residence Route for Legal Residents
attributes.additional_details: We request the Home Office and Parliament to protect the 10‑year long residence route to settlement. This pathway has allowed legal residents to secure stability after a decade of lawful living, working, and contributing in the UK. Families who followed the rules in good faith would face repeated financial strain. Children raised here deserve stability, not insecurity. Communities benefit from long‑term residents who are fully integrated and invested in the UK’s future.
attributes.background: The 10-year long residence route is not merely a policy mechanism; it is a lifeline for individuals and families who have demonstrated commitment to the UK. Abolishing it would be unjust, destabilizing, and contrary to the values of fairness and stability that underpin our society.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/751812
